column4: If required, give new category name
column6: further merging is possible: other and unspecified super categories

column5: “Sepsis”: any ICD10 code description that has the word “sepsis” in it, gets a one-hot encoded 1 for this new category. Use regex with ignore case. Keep the original categories - performe the usual below exceptions then the default pruning.
A04.7x should all me merged to the parent A04.7, and the name changed to "Cdiff A04 7x"
note may have to create a new name e.g. remove the fullstop so that other functions like parent and prune don't affect it
Merge pure A08, A08.3, A08.31, A08.39, A08.4 and A08.8 to “viral other and unspecified”
after the merging of A08s as above, anything else that remains with "A08" in the ICD10 code (regex) should be kept (and not pruned)
after the above merging, keep all ICD codes with A28 in the code (regex)

column2: Sepsis due to other Gram-negative organisms

column5: i.e. besides A69.2x which all turn into one category, all other A69s undergo default pruning
prune here as we need to prune these codes before we merge them
if we don't prune here, we would be merging the top level codes only
then under default pruning there will no longer be a top level category to prune to
and we will end up with more categories than required
i.e. prune the rest of B38
